ai.question: RIPv1 has been correctly configured between router RTR1, RTR2 and RTR3. What will happen when a routing change occurs in network 192.168.10.0/24?

choice.text: RTR3 will not find out about the routing updates.
RTR1 and RTR3 will not find out about the routing updates.
RTR2 will keep the updates confined to the internal LAN.
RTR1 will pass the routing update information to RTR3.

ai.question: The administrator has decided to use sub-interfaces on RTR1 and has decided to continue using RIPv1. What should the administrator do on RTR1?

choice.text:
Obtain another DLCI from the ISP and use the commands below on RTR1
RTR1(config-if)# interface serial 0/0.1 point-to-point
RTR1(config-subif)# ip address 10.10.10.1 255.255.255.252
RTR1(config-subif)# frame-relay interface-dlci 101
RTR1(config-subif)# interface serial 0/0.2 point-to-point
RTR1(config-subif)# ip address 10.10.10.5 255.255.255.252
RTR1(config-subif)# frame-relay interface-dlci [new_DLCI]

Use the commands below on RTR1
RTR1(config-if)# interface serial 0/0.1 point-to-point
RTR1(config-subif)# ip address 10.10.10.1 255.255.255.252
RTR1(config-subif)# frame-relay interface-dlci 201
RTR1(config-subif)# interface serial 0/0.2 point-to-point
RTR1(config-subif)# ip address 10.10.10.5 255.255.255.252
RTR1(config-subif)# frame-relay interface-dlci 431

Use the commands below on RTR1
RTR1(config-if)# interface serial 0/0.1 multipoint
RTR1(config-subif)# ip address 10.10.10.1 255.255.255.240
RTR1(config-subif)# frame-relay interface-dlci 201
RTR1(config-subif)# frame-relay interface-dlci 431

Obtain another DLCI from the ISP and use the commands below on RTR1
RTR1(config-if)# interface serial 0/0.1 multipoint
RTR1(config-subif)# ip address 10.10.10.1 255.255.255.240
RTR1(config-subif)# frame-relay interface-dlci 101
RTR1(config-subif)# frame-relay interface-dlci [new_DLCI]

ai.question: If the administrator decides to implement multipoint subinterfaces on RTR1, which statement is true if the administrator continues to use the RIPv1 routing protocol?

choice.text: Inverse ARP will need to be defined using static mappings.
Routing updates from 192.168.10.0/24 will not be passed to the 192.168.20.0/24 network.
The DLCIs will need to be changed to ensure each site has the same DLCI.
The Frame Relay encapsulations must be ‘cisco’ on each router.

ai.question: The routing protocol in use between the three routers is RIPv1. The administrator wants to ensure that the FTP server is available to the 192.168.50.0/24 network, even if the Frame Relay connection fails. How should the administrator design a backup link to the FTP server?

choice.text:
Configure a static route with the command:
ip route 192.168.10.0 255.255.255.0 interface serial0/0

Configure a static route with the command:
ip route 192.168.10.0 255.255.255.0 interface serial0/1 150
Install a second circuit to a separate Frame Relay service provider and use a CIR of zero.
Change the routing protocol to a classless protocol, such as OSPF.
